t: Amazon ramps up luxury push with bet on high-end beauty | Vogue Business

t: Amazon launches Luxury Stores to separate the hoi polloi from the haute couture | The Verge
s: September 15, 2020 - Amazon is attempting yet again to attract high-end and designer brands. It’s launching a new concept it calls Luxury Stores: invitation-only shops available in the company’s mobile app, which lets brands control how their wares are presented. The first partner is Oscar de la Renta.

t: Amazon’s big breakthrough into designer fashion | Vogue Business
s: May 19, 2020 - Once an unlikely partner to luxury fashion, the global pandemic has prompted a rethink of Amazon and its e-commerce prowess. The CFDA brokered a deal for American designers to sell on the platform, and the e-commerce giant is in talks with the British Fashion Council. Can it work?
